    • Graph drawing with netplot

Graph drawing with netplot

George G. Vega Yon

2018-05-02

Some features:

  1. Auto-scaling of vertices using sizes relative to the plotting device.
  2. Embedded edge color mixer.
  3. True curved edges drawing.
  4. User-defined edge curvature.
  5. Nicer vertex frame color.
  6. Better use of space filling the plotting device.

Introduction

library(netplot)
library(igraph)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'igraph'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     decompose, spectrum
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     union

data("UKfaculty", package = "igraphdata")

set.seed(225)
l <- layout_with_fr(UKfaculty)

oldpar <- par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(UKfaculty, layout = l)
sna::gplot(as.matrix(as_adj(UKfaculty)), coord = l)
nplot(UKfaculty, layout = l)
par(oldpar)

Comparision of default igraph vs netplot default call. nplot fills completely the plotting area, and adjusts vertex size, edge width, and edge arrows’ size accordingly to the plotting area and plotting device.

Nodes

oldpar <- par(mfrow=c(2,2))
nplot(UKfaculty, layout = l, vertex.size.range = c(.025, .025))
nplot(UKfaculty, layout = l, vertex.size.range = c(.01, .025))
nplot(UKfaculty, layout = l, vertex.size.range = c(.01, .025, 4))
nplot(UKfaculty, layout = l, vertex.size.range = c(.02, .05, 4))

Modifying vertex.size.range: Each figure shows a different parameter for the vertex size range. From left to right, and top down: (a) Has all vertices with the same scale of 2.5%, (b) 

par(oldpar)
nplot(make_ring(5), vertex.shape = 2:6,
      vertex.size.range = c(.1,.1),
      edge.curvature = 0)

Number of sides for node drawing.

Edges

set.seed(12233)

x <- sample_smallworld(1, size = 10, nei = 2, .1)
l <- layout_with_fr(x)
oldpar <- par(mfrow = c(1,3))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.color.mix = 1, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.color.mix = .5, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.color.mix = 0, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))

Modifying edge.color.mix: Each figure shows a different parameter for the edge color mixer. From left to right, (a) colors the edges as alter, (b) mixes ego and alter’s colors, and (c) only uses ego 

par(oldpar)
oldpar <- par(mfrow = c(1,3))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.curvature = 0, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.curvature = pi/2, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.curvature = pi, vertex.size.range = c(.05,.1))

Modifying edge.curvature: Each figure shows a different parameter for the edge curvature. From left to right, (a) straight edges, (b) the edge between ego and alter is an arc that measures \(\pi/2\) radians (90 degree), and (c) the edge as an arc between ego and alter that measures \(\pi\) radians (180 degrees). 

par(oldpar)
oldpar <- par(mfrow = c(2,2))
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.line.breaks=3)
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.line.lty = 2, edge.line.breaks=10)
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.line.lty = 3, edge.line.breaks=10)
nplot(x, layout = l, edge.line.lty = 4, edge.line.breaks=10)

Changing the number of breaks in the edge (arc) and the type of line to be drawn. 

par(oldpar)
